intro: Galium remotiflorum, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Galium remotiflorum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
